alert.note: Alert for Idaho Palouse; Lewis and Southern Nez Perce Counties; Lewiston Area (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 25 at 11:04AM MDT until October 26 at 2:00PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FIRST SNOW EVENT FOR THE INLAND NORTHWEST TODAY... .Significant mountain snow accumulation above 3000 feet and measurable snow for lower elevations below 2500 feet. A robust and cold weather system will deliver mountain snow, lowland rain-snow, and colder overnight temperatures lingering through the remainder of the week. Mountain passes will be impacted by the heavy snowfall and lowland areas may see impacts to trees and sensitive vegetation from wet snow accumulation. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 PM PDT THURSDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected mainly ABOVE 2000 FEET. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches above 2000 feet. Trace of snow below 2000 feet. * WHERE...Nezperce, Moscow, Genesee, Potlatch, Tekoa, Lewiston Grade, Pullman, Rosalia, Soldiers Meadow Road, Craigmont, Gifford, Uniontown, Oakesdale, and Winchester. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 1 PM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. This may impact the Thursday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Idaho Palouse; Lewis and Southern Nez Perce Counties; Lewiston Area
